TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . She was represented before the Court by Mrs I. Rajtáková , a lawyer practising in PERSON . The Government of GPE ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant and another person filed an action under LAW of DATE .

On DATE ORG in PERSON ordered the defendant to pay a sum of money to the plaintiffs . It decided to deal in a separate set of proceedings with the claims concerning compensation for movable property and compulsory lease of the land in issue . Finally , ORG rejected the remainder of the action .
ORG in GPE and ORG in PERSON determined the claims for compensation on DATE and DATE . The claims related to the lease of the property were to be determined separately .

In the meantime , on DATE , bankruptcy proceedings were brought against the first defendant . The proceedings in respect of that defendant were therefore stayed pending the outcome of the bankruptcy proceedings . The applicant registered her claims against that person in the context of the bankruptcy proceedings on DATE .
On DATE the applicant filed a complaint with ORG . She complained about delays in the proceedings before ORG .

On DATE ORG found that ORG had violated the applicant ’s right under LAW to a hearing within a reasonable time . ORG noted that the case fell within its competence ratione temporis as from DATE only . It nevertheless had regard also to the period during which the proceedings had been pending prior to that date . After having analysed the proceedings in the light of the criteria which the ORG applies under LAW , the Constitutional Court reached the conclusion that the overall period of DATE was clearly excessive and that the way in which ORG had acted was , as a whole , contrary to the applicant ’s right to a hearing within a reasonable time .
ORG ordered ORG in PERSON to proceed with the case without any further delay . It also ordered that ORG should pay MONEY ( SKK ) to the applicant within DATE .
On DATE ORG asked the plaintiffs to complete their submission of DATE .
The parties made several submissions to ORG DATE and DATE .
ORG held a hearing on DATE . It decided to obtain an expert opinion with a view to determining the rent payable in respect of the land in issue .
DATE and CARDINAL DATE the file was put at the disposal of ORG in PERSON .

On DATE ORG asked the parties to pay an advance on an expert ’s fees . On DATE it appointed an expert who was requested to submit an opinion within DATE . The decision was served on the expert on DATE .
On DATE the expert asked for further documents .

DATE ORG obtained documentary evidence from several co - operatives and an administrative authority . It submitted the evidence thus obtained to the expert on DATE . The expert was asked to obtain information in respect of co - operatives which had not replied to the court ’s request .
On DATE ORG heard a witness . CARDINAL other witnesses representing the co - operatives concerned failed to appear .
At the expert ’s requests ORG obtained further documentary evidence on DATE , DATE and DATE .
The expert submitted his opinion on DATE . The parties submitted their comments on it on CARDINAL and DATE .

ORG held a hearing on DATE . It delivered a judgment in which it partly granted the applicant ’s claims related to compulsory lease of the property by the second defendant . It decided to deal in a separate set of proceedings with the relevant claim related to the first defendant in respect of whom bankruptcy proceedings were still pending .
On CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE the second defendant and the plaintiffs appealed . After the court fee had been paid , ORG submitted the case to the court of appeal on DATE .

On DATE ORG in PERSON quashed a part of the first - instance judgment on the ground that ORG had proceeded and decided erroneously in several respects . The decision of the court of appeal was transmitted to ORG on DATE .
On DATE the applicant specified her claim . She submitted further documents in DATE and DATE .
On DATE ORG gave a new judgment on the point in issue .
On DATE the second defendant appealed . The file was submitted to the court of appeal on DATE .
ORG in GPE upheld the relevant part of the first - instance judgment on DATE . The decision on the point in issue became final on DATE .
